headline: Sandisk Stock Gained +1,500% Since Its Debut. Why This Trader Is Looking Elsewhere.

headline: Western Digital Targets 100TB AI Hard Drives As Hyperscale Demand Grows
summary: Western Digital used its recent Innovation Day to unveil AI focused hard drive technologies and a roadmap targeting 100TB+ HDDs by 2029. The company announced qualification of 40TB UltraSMR drives aimed at hyperscale and large enterprise workloads. New High Bandwidth Drive and Dual Pivot actuator technologies are designed to boost HDD performance and power efficiency for AI data environments. Western Digital, traded as NasdaqGS:WDC, is putting storage for AI workloads at the center of its...

headline: What Western Digital (WDC)'s AI-Centric 100TB Drive Roadmap and Bigger Buybacks Mean For Shareholders
summary: At its past Innovation Day 2026, Western Digital unveiled an AI-focused storage roadmap, including customer-qualifying 40TB UltraSMR ePMR hard drives, a pathway to 100TB HAMR drives by 2029, and new performance and power-optimized HDD technologies, alongside expanding its share repurchase authorization to US$6.00 billion and maintaining a US$0.125 dividend. The combination of ultra-high-capacity drives, AI-oriented performance enhancements, and an intelligent software platform for...

headline: Western Digital Stock Just Got a New Street-High Price Target. Should You Buy WDC Now?

headline: Should You Invest in Western Digital (WDC) Based on Bullish Wall Street Views?
summary: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Western Digital (WDC) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Tech Tantrum
summary: Tech stocks continued their selloff. Tuesday’s software rout spread Wednesday to AI-enabling stocks that had rallied a lot this year. The biggest loser in the Nasdaq-100 was chip maker Advanced Micro Devices, which fell 17% after reporting worse-than-expected results.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Tech Tantrum

headline: Western Digital’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Western Digital’s fourth quarter results surpassed Wall Street’s expectations on both revenue and non-GAAP profitability, yet the market responded negatively. Management attributed the strong performance to robust demand for higher-capacity nearline hard drives, especially from cloud and hyperscale customers, as well as a favorable mix shift toward UltraSMR and ePMR products. CEO Tiang Yew Tan emphasized that “firm purchase orders with our top seven customers through calendar year 2026” signaled
